t: The Reign of the Lord’s Anointed
Why*pn do the nations rage and*ld the peoples plot in vain?
The*ln kings of the earth set themselves, and*ld the rulers take counsel together, against*ld the Lord*s and against his Anointed, saying,
“Let*ln us burst their bonds apart and*ld cast away their cords from us.”
He*pn who sits in the heavens laughs; the*ld Lord holds them in derision.
Then*ln he will speak to them in his wrath, and*ld terrify them in his fury, saying,
“As*ln for me, I have set my King on*ld Zion, my holy hill.”
I*pn will tell of the decree: The*ln Lord*s said to me, “You are my Son; today*ld I have begotten you.
Ask*ln of me, and I will make the nations your heritage, and*ld the ends of the earth your possession.
You*ln shall break them with a rod of iron and*ld dash them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.”
Now*pn therefore, O kings, be wise; be*ld warned, O rulers of the earth.
Serve*ln the Lord*s with fear, and*ld rejoice with trembling.
Kiss*ln the Son, lest*ld he be angry, and you perish in the way, for*ld his wrath is quickly kindled. Blessed*ln are all who take refuge in him.
